definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: They were in proper tennis whites .
sentences.chinese: 他们都穿着可体的白色网球服。

sentences.english: She made a cheongsam especially for this performance that fits her very well.
sentences.chinese: 为了这次演出，她特意定做了一身可体的旗袍。

sentences.english: The physiological action is similar to that of hydrocortisone.
sentences.chinese: 生理行动与那是相似于氢化可体松。

definition: pubic region/point two inches below the navel where one's qi resides
surface of the body/periphery of the body/body thermometer/(literary) a person's appearance
the body/organism (usually human)/(fig.) fabric (of society etc)/cohesive structure (of an entity)
to wrap tightly/to wind tightly/to bind/close-fitting (clothes)
to contain/to hold/content/(of a poem etc) full of implicit meaning
variant of 氣|气[qi4], breath/air/steam/gas/weather/used in Taoist charms
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
to show one's true nature (derog.)/to betray oneself
